text: Ellen White (November 26, 1827 – July 16, 1915) was a prolific author, writing more than 80 books, 200 fliers, and 5000 periodical articles. There are over 60,000 manuscript pages of her writings. She was one of the founders of the Seventh-day Adventist Church, believed by many readers to have the spiritual gift of prophecy described in the Bible. ==Major titles== The following is a list of Ellen White's most popular and influential writings. Conflict of the Ages (book series) (see also modern adaptations below): # Patriarchs and Prophets - Reflections on the first half of the Old TestamentWhite Estate link # Prophets and Kings - Reflections on the second half of the Old Testament.White Estate link # The Desire of Ages - Reflections on the life of ChristWhite Estate link # The Acts of the Apostles - Reflections on the early New Testament churchWhite Estate link # The Great Controversy - Reflections on Christian history and prophecies about the end timesWhite Estate link Others: * Steps to Christ - an evangelistic book explaining how to have a living connection with Jesus ChristWhite Estate link * Christ's Object Lessons - an exposition of the meaning of the parables of JesusWhite Estate link * Thoughts from the Mount of Blessing - an exposition of Jesus' lessons in the Sermon on the MountWhite Estate link * Testimonies for the Church, 9 vols. 1855–1909See Ronald Graybill, "" Ministry 67:4 (April 1994), p8–13 (part I concerns her first vision) * Early Writings * Selected Messages 1958, 1980 * Education * The Ministry of Healing * Dark Before Dawn ==Books== Information includes title, date of first publication, publisher, edition, pages, and common abbreviation of the book title. [1T, 2T, etc.]) === Contemporary adaptations === Modern adaptations of White's books have been produced which update and simplify the language. Editors have tried to preserve the original meaning.Cindy Tutsch, "Making Ellen White's Writings Kid-Friendly ". Adventist World (January 2010) * A Call to Stand Apart, an adaptation and compilation of various topics Adaptations of the 5-volume "Conflict of the Ages" series have been commissioned by the General Conference to complement the Cornerstone Sabbath School lessons in 2007–2011.
